issue.title: proper decorations with title and window buttons

repository.name: glfw
repository.description: A multi-platform library for OpenGL, OpenGL ES, Vulkan, window and input

issue.body:
This adds [`libdecor`](https://gitlab.gnome.org/jadahl/libdecor) for proper client-side window decoration support:
![glfw_decorations](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8573621/81483971-ddc9c300-9239-11ea-9893-cbad56af6561.png)

(cc @jadahl)

~~This PR currently checks out a development branch that contains some PRs that haven't been merged upstream yet.~~

For now, I am mainly interested to get some feedback on the decoration requirements in GLFW and see if `libdecor` fits your needs. Once the remaining PRs have been merged upstream, I would appreciate if GLFW could gain proper decoration support by merging this.

I also included some minor changes to remove glitches during resizing.

Fixes #1639 .

body: Yes, I definitely want to add libdecor support as soon as possible and considering GNOME's lack of server-side decorations, this is a blocking issue for a 3.4 release of any scope.

issue.title: Wayland window is undecorated - has no close button

repository.name: glfw
repository.description: A multi-platform library for OpenGL, OpenGL ES, Vulkan, window and input

issue.body:
It's curious, that there is apparently no bug report for this. I am building the current glfw (commit dd8a678a66f1967372e5a5e3deac41ebf65ee127) examples with `-DGLFW_BUILD_WAYLAND=ON -DGLFW_BUILD_X11=OFF`. The resultant window has no close button and looks very different to how it appears, if built for X11 (even when running under Wayland). `GLFW_DECORATED` set to true or false has no effect.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1381995/195618552-7c4aafae-662f-4491-8c08-c3d1d6026785.png)


```
GNOME Version 42.4
OS Name: Ubuntu 22.04.1 LTS
Windowing System: Wayland
Graphics: nvidia-driver-515
``` 

There are lots of other problems with Wayland, but this one is the most prominent.

body:
What's the current status of this? Libdecor is in a usable state now, and SSDs aren't required by the Wayland spec, so it'd be useful to have.

Linking the MR: https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/1639

issue.title: There are no window decorations on Wayland
issue.body:
Changed right after you introduced the Wayland backend. Seems like this [autogenerated decoration](https://github.com/wolfpld/tracy/blob/462d8103aafded1714a9189f5ffb39520355a995/profiler/src/wayland/xdg-decoration.c) doesn't work:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49961859/209439708-119ca73a-e272-4b72-96fa-e531bc42a155.png)

body: Please come over to #2285 for updates on this.

issue.title: Native window decorations for GNOME Wayland

repository.name: kitty
repository.description: If you live in the terminal, kitty is made for you! Cross-platform, fast, feature-rich, GPU based.

issue.body:
Hi, im a developer, and Im interested in kitty, I was sad when I saw it doesn't support client side decorations, since im a wayland gnome user, I would love to say I have other options, but sadly with my HiDPI monitor, it looks like wayland is my only option.

I would be glad to try to get to some extent some client side decorations working, what is kitty missing to support this feature? is it possible? is the possibility of supporting this good? 

Thanks! And of course thank you for your awesome software, it makes using the terminal much much better.

body: The documentation for this option are missing from HTML docs. Maybe they should be added?
